title: Eurovision's noisy fans are back despite Dutch pandemic
description: It's Europe's most popular cultural event and the Netherlands will host it despite battling a third Covid wave.

title: Violent judo class in Taiwan leaves seven year old in a coma
description: The incident in Taiwan shows a tendency to allow child abuse in the name of discipline, experts say.

title: Taking an invention from idea to the marketplace
description: Lockdown spurred many people to invent new products, but how did they get to market?

title: Roma 3-2 Man Utd (5-8 on aggregate): 'Faith in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer close to being rewarded'
description: It would seem automatic for Manchester United to reward manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer with a new contract after taking them to the Europa League final, says Simon Stone.

title: Arsenal 'devastated' by Europa League exit but where does club go now?
description: BBC Sport gathers reaction from the manager, players, pundits and more to gauge the mood after a disastrous night for Arsenal - and asks where the club goes from here.

title: Covid and pregnancy - should you get the vaccine?
description: As the Covid vaccine is rolled out to younger age groups, BBC News looks at what it means for anyone expecting a baby.

title: 'They have guns but we have people': Inside Myanmar's Spring Revolution
description: A musician and his sister in Yangon have been filming for the BBC in Myanmar in the aftermath of a coup.

title: 2021 elections: What are the results in my area?
description: National elections in Scotland and Wales and local elections in England took place on 6 May 2021.

title: What to expect in Scottish election
description: Scots have cast their votes, but they will not be counted until Friday and Saturday - when will the outcome be known?

title: Grand Canyon lottery to kill bison gathers 45,000 entries
description: A chance to shoot a rare buffalo in the famed US National Park drew over 45,000 applicants.

title: India Covid: The agony of watching a catastrophe from afar
description: Seeing loved ones suffering in India, millions of families are trying to do their best from afar.

title: Covid: The vaccine patent row explained
description: The US says it supports a temporary lift on vaccine patents, but some countries have pushed back.

title: The Coronation Street storyline based on a real-life murder
description: The plot is drawn from the killing of Sophie Lancaster in 2007, who was murdered for being a goth.

title: Jersey fishing: What's the row between UK and France about?
description: French fishing boats protest at the port of St Helier, in dispute over access to waters around the island.

title: SpaceX: The rocky road to a smooth rocket landing
description: As the latest Starship prototype completes a successful ascent and landing, here's its route to success.

title: Elections 2021: Dogs at polling stations
description: Voters are heading to the polls in England, Scotland and Wales - and so are their canine companions.

title: Byron burger death: No damages payout for Owen Carey's family
description: Owen Carey's family officially launch their campaign for a law change following his death in 2017.

title: Animal rescuers use mother duck YouTube video to save ducklings
description: Rescuers used footage of a mother duck's call to lure the young birds to safety at a busy roadside.

title: No full-time return to the office for over a million
description: Almost all of 50 big UK firms tell the BBC staff will divide their time between home and office in future.

title: UK economy set to grow at fastest rate in more than 70 years
description: Economy expected to grow by 7.25% in 2021 as lockdown restrictions are eased, says Bank of England.

title: Simmonds makes Lions squad but no place for Sexton
description: Exeter number eight Sam Simmonds is a surprise inclusion ahead of Billy Vunipola in a 37-man British and Irish Lions squad, with two-time tourist Johnny Sexton left out.

title: Jersey officials hold talks with French fishermen over rights dispute
description: Two Royal Navy ships and two French boats are nearby, with the row over post-Brexit rights ongoing.

title: 'It's more personal' - Alvarez sends Saunders message in Texas
description: Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez says Billy Joe Saunders' pursuit of him has made Saturday's Texas fight "more personal".

title: Elections 2021: Millions voting in bumper set of polls
description: Local and national contests - some delayed by Covid - are taking place in England, Scotland and Wales.

title: Antony Blinken: US will respond to reckless Russian acts
description: The US would prefer more stable and predictable ties with Russia, Antony Blinken tells the BBC.

title: Jenny Agutter to reprise Railway Children role in film sequel
description: The actress will reprise her role as Bobbie Waterbury, more than 50 years after the original film.

title: Mayra Zulfiqar shooting: Police had been warned before killing
description: Mayra Zulfiqar asked for protection in Pakistan less than two weeks before she died, the BBC learns.

title: Alcohol deaths highest for 20 years in England and Wales
description: Last year, deaths rose from March onwards and were mostly related to long-term drinking problems.

title: Little Mix on baby news and being a trio
description: The British girl group open up about Leigh-Anne keeping her pregnancy secret, and life after Jesy.

title: India Covid aid: Is emergency relief reaching those in need?
description: Emergency relief is flowing into India but concerns are mounting about delays in supply.

title: Menu from 1913 found during Liverpool cafe refurb
description: It features a selection of popular dishes from the time including grilled kidneys and "boiled fowl".

title: Team GB & ParalympicsGB unveil kit for delayed Tokyo Games
description: Team GB and ParalympicsGB athletes will wear a kit that "represents unity in diversity" at the Tokyo Olympic and Paralympic Games.

title: Nick Kamen: Madonna heartbroken by singer and model's death
description: The Levi's model, actor and singer's biggest hit single was co-written by the queen of pop.

title: Queen wishes great-grandson Archie happy birthday
description: The son of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, who live in California, turns two today.

title: The Papers: PM 'sends gunboats to Jersey' and 'Navy to face the French'
description: The UK sending Royal Navy vessels to Jersey amid a row over fishing rights with France features on the front pages.

title: Lelush: How a sulky Russian model became China's slacker icon
description: Getting trapped in a boy band reality TV contest was just the start of Lelush's unlikely journey.

title: Safe Sweden faces up to wave of women's killings
description: A spate of deaths reignites a debate about domestic violence in a country praised for gender equality.
